title: Sub Question 1
stimulusHtml:
3 points maximum

1 point: for the correct translation of insuetum: unaccustomed, unused, inexperienced, unusual, unexpected, uncharted, unknown, untravelled, or strange.

2 points: for an explanation which described Daedalus as the pioneer of human flight or as traveling along an unusual route.

1 point: if the description is very limited but minimally correct.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

1 point: for the correct translation of insuetum: unaccustomed, unused, inexperienced, unusual, unexpected, uncharted, unknown, untravelled, or strange.

2 points: for an explanation which described Daedalus as the pioneer of human flight or as traveling along an unusual route.

1 point: if the description is very limited but minimally correct.

Student response earns one of the available points.

1 point: if the description is very limited but minimally correct.

Student response earns two of the available points.

1 point: if the description is very limited but minimally correct.

Student response earns three of the available points.

2 points: for an explanation which described Daedalus as the pioneer of human flight or as traveling along an unusual route.

title: Sub Question 2
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

1 point: for a definition of apostrophe: a "turning away" to address a person or thing present or absent or dead. Equating this figure with the use of the vocative is not enough.

1 point: for identifying the example (addressing Apollo) and giving the correct Latin — tibi, Phoebe, or Phoebe; tibi alone is insufficient.
descriptions:

title: Sub Question 3
stimulusHtml:
4 points maximum

1 point: for each Latin citation:
sacravit remigium alarum or alarum posuit(que) immania templa or templa

1 point: for the translation/explanation for each gift.
